isis.stitle: DCM AND DDM DRUM TYPE PARKING BRAKE - ADJUSTMENT

svcproc.title: ROCKWELL OR BENDIX BRAKES WITH MANUAL ACTUATION
svcproc.para: Adjustment is required when the lining, shoes, or drum is replaced. If lining material is worn to .100 inch (2.5 mm) or within 0.020 inch (.51 mm) of rivet head at thinnest point, replace lining, or shoe and lining assemblies.
Refer to Figure 6for Item numbers in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

figure.caption: Figure 20. Parking Brake Adjustment with Orscheln Hand Lever

step1.para: Block wheels to prevent vehicle from moving.
Position parking brake hand lever (Item 2) in the released position with the knob wound out fully counterclockwise.

Move brake actuator lever (Item 6) in apply direction to a position where contact is made between the brake cam and shoes but without any shoe movement. This will remove excess clearance in mechanism.
Remove the clevis pin. Adjust clevis (Item 4) until hole in clevis aligns with mating hole in brake actuator lever.
Assemble clevis to actuator lever and tighten clevis locknut.
Turn adjusting knob on end of hand lever clockwise until a force of 80 to 90 lbs. (36 to 41 kg) is attained to apply the parking brake, for maximum effectiveness.

The Orscheln (parking) brake lever is the over-center locking type. It is tightened (while released) by turning the adjusting knob clockwise. When properly adjusted, it pulls over center with a distinct click.
